summary: This document is an email exchange between Peter Coulthard and an unnamed recipient, discussing the recipient's past attempts to testify in the Jean Luc Brunel trial and being prevented from doing so. It references the recipient's emotional television interviews outside Epstein's properties in Paris and New York.

persons.name: Peter Coulthard
persons.context: The author of the email, responding to a message about the recipient's experience with the French investigation into Jean Luc Brunel. He recalls the recipient's televised interviews.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of a French trial for which the email's recipient was asked to testify but was prevented from doing so.

persons.name: Sigrid
persons.context: Named, along with 'the attorneys', as someone who prevented the email recipient from testifying in Jean Luc Brunel's trial.

connections.description: Correspondents in an email exchange discussing the recipient's past involvement with the French investigation into Jean Luc Brunel.
The recipient was contacted by French authorities to help with and testify in Jean Luc Brunel's trial.
Sigrid, along with attorneys, prevented the recipient from testifying in the Brunel trial.

events.title: French TV interview at Epstein Paris residence
events.description: The email recipient conducted a televised interview where they were knocking at the door of Epstein's Paris residence and crying due to an antagonistic response from staff.

events.title: Televised crying outside Epstein New York premises
events.description: Following the Paris interview, the recipient was televised crying outside Epstein's New York property.

events.title: Prevention from testifying in Brunel trial
events.description: The email recipient states they were contacted to testify in Jean Luc Brunel's trial but were prevented from doing so by Sigrid and attorneys, who sent someone else instead.

keyFacts: An individual claims they were contacted to testify in Jean Luc Brunel's French trial but were prevented from doing so by a person named Sigrid and attorneys.
The same individual conducted emotional, televised interviews outside Jeffrey Epstein's residences in Paris and New York.
The correspondence suggests the individual's public actions (the interviews) may have been a reason they were asked to stop supporting French authorities.
